objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: Primary author and publisher of the report; provided analysis, indicators, and detection rules (YARA and Snort) for Pygmy Goat.

objects.name: libsophos.so
objects.description: Malicious shared object used by Pygmy Goat; loaded via LD_PRELOAD into /bin/sshd to hook accept and enable backdoor functionality.

objects.name: Pygmy Goat IPC Unix server socket
objects.description: Unix socket used by Pygmy Goat to forward data for backdoor SSH connections and internal comms.

objects.name: Pygmy Goat IPC Unix client socket
objects.description: Additional Unix IPC socket filename used by Pygmy Goat, indicating FortiGate targeting.

objects.name: Pygmy Goat IPC Unix server socket (older sample)
objects.description: Unix socket path observed in older Pygmy Goat samples for inter-process communication.

objects.name: Pygmy Goat single-instance pid file
objects.description: PID file used by Pygmy Goat to ensure single-instance execution on victim device.

objects.name: Pygmy Goat single-instance pid file (variant)
objects.description: Variant PID file used by Pygmy Goat to enforce single-instance execution (noted in detection section).

objects.name: Pygmy Goat single-instance pid file (older sample)
objects.description: PID file path used by older Pygmy Goat samples to ensure single-instance execution.

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of Pygmy Goat malicious shared object loaded into /bin/sshd (current variant).

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of Pygmy Goat malicious shared object loaded into /bin/sshd (current variant).

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of Pygmy Goat malicious shared object loaded into /bin/sshd (current variant).

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so (earlier variant) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of earlier Pygmy Goat variant of libsophos.so (VMProtect-obfuscated; lacks reverse proxy functionality).

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so (earlier variant) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of earlier Pygmy Goat variant of libsophos.so (VMProtect-obfuscated; lacks reverse proxy functionality).

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so (earlier variant) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of earlier Pygmy Goat variant of libsophos.so (VMProtect-obfuscated; lacks reverse proxy functionality).

objects.name: pygmy goat
objects.description: Pygmy Goat is a native x86-32 ELF shared object backdoor discovered on Sophos XG firewall devices. It achieves persistence and execution by using the LD_PRELOAD environment variable to inject into /bin/sshd and hook its accept function. The malware listens on a raw ICMP socket for AES-encrypted "magic" packets that contain a callback IP and port, or it detects a specific SSH protocol banner via the hooked accept function to initiate command-and-control. It establishes TLS connections to its C2 using an embedded CA certificate masquerading as Fortinet, and supports commands including spawning /bin/sh or /bin/csh remote shells, starting packet capture via libpcap, creating cron tasks through an embedded BusyBox crontab, and creating a reverse SOCKS5 proxy using embedded EarthWorm code. Communications are optionally compressed with LZO1X and tunneled, with protocol impersonation via a fake SSH handshake. Older variants lacked reverse proxy functionality and used VMProtect.

objects.name: castletap
objects.description: Referenced as FortiGate-targeting malware reported by Mandiant with TTPs similar to Pygmy Goat, including use of an encrypted ICMP packet carrying C2 information to establish a reverse SSL connection.

objects.name: Sophos
objects.description: Vendor whose XG firewall devices were observed hosting the Pygmy Goat backdoor.

objects.name: Fortinet Ltd.
objects.description: Network device vendor (FortiGate) referenced as the purported issuer in the embedded Root CA certificate used by Pygmy Goat to validate TLS C2.

objects.name: Mandiant
objects.description: Cited industry source reporting on FortiGate device attacks and CASTLETAP malware with similar TTPs.

objects.name: CrowdStrike
objects.description: Cited industry source noting prior threat actor use of EarthWorm.

objects.name: pygmy_goat_aes_key
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: pygmy_goat_magic_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule pygmy_goat_magic_strings
{

meta:

        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Pygmy Goat magic byte sequences used in C2 comms"
        date = "2024-10-22"
        hash1 = "71f70d61af00542b2e9ad64abd2dda7e437536ff"

strings:

$c2_magic_handshake = ",bEB3?=o"
$fake_ssh_banner = "SSH-2.0-D8pjE"
$fake_ed25519_key = { 29 cc f0 cc 16 c5 46 6e 52 19 82 8e 86

65 42 8c 1f 1a d4 c3 a5 b1 cb fc c0 26 6c 31 3c 5c 90 3a 24 7d e4 d3 57
6d da 8e cb f4 66 d1 cb 81 4f 63 fd 4a fa 06 e4 7e 4c a0 95 91 bd cb 97
a4 b3 0f }

condition:

(uint32(0) == 0x464c457f) and any of them

}

objects.name: earthworm_id_generation_x86
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule earthworm_id_generation_x86
{

meta:

        author = "NCSC"
        description = "EarthWorm pool num generation x86 assembly"
        date = "2024-10-22"
        hash1 = "71f70d61af00542b2e9ad64abd2dda7e437536ff"

strings:

$chartoi = {

8b 45 ??        // MOV
c1 e0 07        // SHL
89 c1           // MOV
8b 55 ??        // MOV
8b 45 ??        // MOV
01 d0           // ADD
0f b6 00        // MOVZX
0f be c0        // MOVSX
01 c8           // ADD
89 45 ??        // MOV
83 6d ?? 01     // SUB

EAX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,0x7
ECX,EAX
EDX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,EDX
EAX,byte ptr [EAX]
EAX,AL
EAX,ECX
dword ptr [EBP + ??],EAX
dword ptr [EBP + ??],0x1

}

condition:

}

(uint32(0) == 0x464c457f) and all of them

objects.name: Dynamic Linker Hijacking
objects.description: Pygmy Goat uses the LD_PRELOAD environment variable to inject into sshd

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create a /bin/sh or /bin/csh remote shell

objects.name: Scheduled Task/Job: Cron
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create arbitrary cron tasks using crontab

objects.name: Inter-Process Communication
objects.description: Pygmy Goat uses Unix sockets for inter-process communication between parent and forked child processes

objects.name: Network Sniffing
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can use libpcap to sniff network traffic according to a BPF filter and exfiltrate it to the C2

objects.name: Traffic Signaling: Port Knocking
objects.description: Pygmy Goat listens on an ICMP raw socket for encrypted packets containing magic bytes and the C2 address to connect back to

objects.name: Data Obfuscation: Protocol Impersonation
objects.description: Pygmy Goat responds to an SSH connection that sends magic bytes with a fake SSH handshake

objects.name: Encrypted Channel: Asymmetric Cryptography
objects.description: Pygmy Goat encrypts C2 communications with TLS

objects.name: Protocol Tunneling
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create a reverse SOCKS5 proxy server to tunnel traffic through it

objects.name: Archive Collected Data: Archive via Library
objects.description: Pygmy Goat compresses its C2 communications with LZO1X

objects.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
objects.description: Pygmy Goat exfiltrates its result data over its C2 channel

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Pygmy Goat
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. pygmy goat.
